titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell, Receipt to Louisville & Nashville Rail Road Company
CWG13729

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 5

body.p:
NO. 12.
The State of Kentucky,
To Louisville & Nashville R. R. Co Dr.

row.cell: 1 Man 8th Ky Cavry. From Louisville to Lebanon 67 @ 2Â¢ Miles R
Add United States tax on Passenger Transprtn
Pr circular Q M Genl dated Novr 14/62 402 @ 3x

body.p: I Certify that the Transportation as above charged Was on Bussiness Connected with the recruiting service
Under the Orders of the Governor of the State of Kentucky

John W. Finnell
Adjt. Genl. Ken. Vols.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated: and that they were a necessary for the public service.
Received at Frankfort Ky, the 18 of April -- 1863, of Jno W Finnell Adjt Genl, Quarter-master Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Four Dollars and fourteen Cents, in full of the above account.

NO. 12.
No. 164 Abstract B P Qr. 186.
Lou & Nash R R Co
Dollars 14.14/100
Paid April 18 1863
Lou & Nash R R Coy
